Welcome to QUANTEC Radiation

Our mission is to provide comprehensive, evidence-based radiation dose constraints and guidelines for radiation oncology professionals worldwide.

Explore Resources Learn More

Our Mission

Building upon the foundation laid by the original QUANTEC (Quantitative Analyses of Normal Tissue Effects in the Clinic) initiative, our goal is to provide introductory, methodology, and vision papers regarding the many issues relating to the quantification of radiation dose effects.

The heart and soul of our work is the analysis of organs and tissues that are at risk for radiation injury, providing clinicians with the tools they need to optimize treatment plans while minimizing complications.

Key Resources & Areas of Focus

Cardiac Toxicity

Comprehensive analysis of heart dose constraints and radiation-induced cardiac complications.

Pulmonary Effects

Evidence-based guidelines for lung dose limits and pneumonitis risk assessment.

CNS Tolerance

Central nervous system dose thresholds and cognitive function preservation strategies.

Optic Structures

Visual pathway protection and dose constraints for critical ocular structures.

Pediatric Guidelines

Specialized dose constraints and considerations for pediatric radiation therapy.

NTCP Modeling

Normal tissue complication probability models and risk prediction tools.

For Healthcare Professionals

Our resources are designed for:

  • Radiation Oncologists - Clinical decision support and treatment planning guidance
  • Medical Physicists - Dose calculation verification and safety protocols
  • Dosimetrists - Practical constraints for daily treatment planning
  • Researchers - Latest evidence and ongoing clinical trials
  • Residents & Trainees - Educational materials and case studies

Download our comprehensive dose constraint guidelines and stay updated with the latest evidence-based recommendations.
